derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from French, diminutive of couple, from Old French cople (see couple)

entry.def: A couplet is two lines of poetry which come next to each other, especially two lines that rhyme with each other and are the same length.

means.word_mean: 1. two items of the same kind
2. a stanza consisting of two successive lines of verse; usually rhymed
